hypothesis_content.title: Volatility Compression Breakout Regime Shift
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC 20-day realized volatility falls below its 100-day rolling 20th percentile (compression) AND the 5-day average daily trading range is below 2.5%, the subsequent 5% directional breakout within 5 trading days will signal a new regime (BULL if up, BEAR if down) with momentum persisting for at least 10 days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Extended volatility compression in neutral regimes often precedes significant directional moves as pent-up energy releases. The 5% threshold filters false breakouts while capturing early regime transition signals.
entry_conditions: BTC 20D realized volatility < 20th percentile of 100D rolling window
BTC closes >5% above 20-day high (BULL entry) OR <-5% below 20-day low (BEAR entry)

exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price reverses to pre-breakout 20-day range midpoint

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Breakout direction reverses within 3 days >75% of the time OR subsequent 10-day momentum shows no statistical edge vs random.
